result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin J. Braasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay restitution to Dennis Holterman in the amount of $500
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee

--to pay costs of $243  plus  $200 DNA surcharge

02-08-2016 - The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $371

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to never call demeaning names or raise voice to girlfriend 

 Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes: --to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT work-release privileges, to commence on  9/4/15 at 6:00 pm.

Case called at 3:35pm [mo]

Statement made by Tristen Borden

Defendant copy of order for payment of attorney fees sent to LKA-remailed to Boughton St Address

For Payment of Attorney Fees - It is hereby ordered that:, The Defendant, Gavin Braasch, is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  Attorney fees shall be paid as a condition of Probation.  The Judgment of Conviction shall be amended to reflect said order.
The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $371
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Karl Huebner in the amount of $371 .
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:07am [mo]
Defendant Gavin J. Braasch in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

ADA Shock submits an Amended Information
--Atty. Huebner and Mr. Braasch admit service of the amended Information

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1, #2, and #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement

On Counts #1, #2 and #3 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, WITHOUT work-release privileges, to commence on  9/4/15 at 6:00 pm.

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--On Count #1 of Amended Criminal Complaint: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2 of Amended Criminal Complaint: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 of Amended Criminal Complaint: to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--To pay restitution to Dennis Holterman in the amount of $500
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to never call demeaning names or raise voice to girlfriend

Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 9:30am

Status conference at 08-31-2015 09:00 am
Scheduling Notice

Co-Defendant Gavin J. Braasch in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to timing of Arraignment, ADA Hall indicates that State does not have an Information prepared for today's hearing

The Court inquires of Co-Defendant counsel Atty. Humes (seated in gallery) the posture of that case; Atty. Humes indicates they are prepared to waive preliminary hearing also.
The Court calls case 15CF95 at this time, with Atty. Humes and Co- Defendant Teeghun Taylor joining at the Defense table.

Mr.Taylor waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Atty. Humes and Atty. Huebner indicate that the next date will most likely be an Arraignment along with a plea and sentencing.

[MK] Cases #15CF91, #15CF93, #15CF95 called at 2:34pm. 
Co-Defendant Gavin Braasch in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   
Co-Defendant Riley O'Donnell in court with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Co-Defendant Teeghun Taylor in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes
ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

All Co-Defendants and the State waive Preliminary Hearing time limits.

As to Case #15CF95 only, Initial Apperance is held:  
--Mr. Taylor confirms that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are corrct 
--Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited; the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
--The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
--The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with the Co-Defendants Gavin Braasch, Riley ODonnell 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 2:42pm.

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on May 20th at 1:40 for Mr. Braasch, at 2:00 for Mr. O'Donnell, at 10:20am for Mr. Taylor  (2) Status Conference on June 15th at 2:30pm.
JA response to RUMS
NOH for def sent ot LKA
Def copy of order appointing attorney
Adjourned initial appearance on May 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
The Court appoints Attorney Huebner
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] cases #15CF91 & #15CF93 called at 2:18pm. 
Co-Defendant Gavin J. Braasch in court. 
Co-Defendant Riley D. ODonnell in court.
ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Each Co-Defendant verifies that the dates of birth and addresses listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
As to each Co-Defendant:  Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited, the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given. The Court finds that Mr. Braasch is not competent to represent himself. The Court will appoint counsel for Mr. Braasch at County expense. The Court informs Mr. Braasch that he will be required, at a later point in the case, to make reimbursement payments for these attorney fees.  Co-Defendant ODonnell will contact the State PD Office.  
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance on these cases. 

As to each Co-Defendant: the Court requires a $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with the Co-Defendants (Co-Defendants are Gavin Braasch, Riley ODonnell, Teeghum Taylor) 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
--as to Co-Defendant ODonnell: to report to the Jefferson Public Defenders Office today to make arrangements to apply for Public Defender representation. 
recess 2:31pm. 

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on May 5, 2015 at 2:00pm. (along with Third Co-Defendant's Case #15CF95)
